poem:
Title: "An Ode to Future Gold"

An autumn date when pennies fold,
Inspiring dreams of silver, gold.
To delay, they say, increases hold,
A coin of age, heartily cold.

Life's fickle lottery often rolled,
Could leave your hands joyously bold.
But count on time, its story told,
Shaped by the fates we closely mould.

Is it foolishness or courage bold?
The answer, only time has sold.
